Welcome to Card library’s documentation!¶

This is the documentation for a library of a standard playing card created for computer assignment 2 in DAT171 Object oriented programming in Python.

class cardlib.AceCard(suit: cardlib.Suit)¶

Bases: cardlib.PlayingCards

Creates the Ace card of a given suit.

get_suit()¶

Returns the suit of the card.

get_value()¶

Returns the value of the card.

exception cardlib.EmptyDeckError¶

Bases: Exception

class cardlib.NumberedCard(value: int, suit: cardlib.Suit)¶

Bases: cardlib.PlayingCards

Creates a card of a given value and suit. Only used for cards 2-10.

get_suit()¶

Returns the suit of the card.

get_value()¶

Returns the value of the card.

class cardlib.PlayingCards(suit: cardlib.Suit)¶

Bases: object

This is an abstract class for the playing cards.

get_suit()¶

Returns the suit of the card.

get_value()¶

Returns the value of the card.

class cardlib.PokerHand(cards)¶

Bases: cardlib.Hand

A class that represent the poker hand with functions for identifying the best poker hand.

check_flush(cards=[])¶

Checks for the best flush in a list of cards. It can handle multiple flushes within a single list of cards (if playing with more than one deck).

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:Returns a list of the five highest cards of the suit with the highest flush. Returns None if

no flush is found.

check_four_of_a_kind(cards=[])¶

Checks if the list of cards contain four of a kind.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:Returns a list containing four cards. Returns None if no four of a kind is found.
check_full_house(cards=[])¶

Checks for the best full house in a list of cards.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:Returns a list with the triplet first and then the pair. Return None if no full house is found.
check_high_card(cards=[])¶

Checks for the highest card in a list of cards and returns it.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:The card with the highest value.
check_one_pair(cards=[])¶

Checks for the best pair in a list of cards. If no pair is found it returns None.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:A list containing the best pair in separate tuples for each card. Returns None if no pair is found.
check_straight(cards=[])¶

Checks for the best straight in a list of cards.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:The the highest value card in the straight. Returns None if no straight is found.
check_straight_flush(cards=[])¶

Checks a list of cards for the best straight flush.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:Returns the highest-ranking card in the flush. If no flush is found it returns None.
check_three_of_a_kind(cards=[])¶

Checks if the list of cards contain three of a kind.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:A list containing the three cards as tuples. Returns None if no pair is found.
check_two_pair(cards=[])¶

Returns the two highest pairs if the list of cards has at least two pairs in it.

Parameters:cards – List of cards to check in addition of self.
Returns:A list containing the best two pairs with the highest pair first. Returns None if no pairs are found.

class cardlib.StandardDeck¶

Bases: object

A class that represent a standard card game deck, with functions for creating a complete deck and shuffling it.

create_deck()¶

Creates a standard deck of 52 cards.

draw_card(amount: int)¶

Draws the specified amount of cards from the top of the deck.

shuffle()¶

Shuffles the cards in the deck.

class cardlib.Suit¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Class Suit contains the four suits (club, diamond, spade, heart) and their respective order (club < diamond < spade < heart)
